Title: Peak ground acceleration in g
Description: The largest *increase* in velocity recorded at a particular location during an earthquake. Expressed in g - the standard acceleration due to Earth's gravity, equivalent to g-force (1 g = 9.81 m/s2).

Title: Peak ground acceleration in gal
Description: The largest *increase* in velocity recorded at a particular location during an earthquake. Expressed in multiples of gal, where 1 gal is equal to 0.01 m/s2 (1 g = 981 gal).

Title: Peak ground acceleration in m/s^2
Description: The largest *increase* in velocity recorded at a particular location during an earthquake. Expressed in meters per second squared (m/s2).

Title: Peak ground velocity in m/s
Description: The greatest speed of ground shaking recorded at a particular location during an earthquake. Expressed in meters per second (m/s).

Title: Peak ground velocity in cm/s
Description: The greatest speed of ground shaking recorded at a particular location during an earthquake. Expressed in centimeters per second (cm/s).

Title: Average spectral acceleration in m/s^2
Description: The mean of the spectral accelerations at a set of periods that are crucial for risk assessment and loss estimation of a structure of interest. Expressed in meters per second squared (m/s2).

Title: Spectral acceleration (period: 1 sec) in m/s^2
Description: The spectral acceleration at a period of 1 second. Expressed in meters per second squared (m/s2).

Title: Spectral acceleration (period: 0.3 sec) in m/s^2
Description: The spectral acceleration at a period of 0.3 second. Expressed in meters per second squared (m/s2).

Title: Spectral displacement
Description: The maximum displacement experienced by a structure, as modelled by a mass on a vertical spring having the same natural period of vibration, T, as the building. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Spectral velocity
Description: The maximum velocity experienced by a structure, as modelled by a mass on a vertical spring having the same natural period of vibration, T, as the building. Expressed in meters per second (m/s).

Title: Permanent ground deformation
Description: The displacement of the ground surface due to the movement of a fault. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Significant duration
Description: The time interval over which the integral of the square of the ground acceleration is within a defined percentage range. Expressed in seconds (s).

Title: Arias intensity (IÎ±) or (IA) or (Ia)
Description: A measure of the strength of ground motion. Expressed in meters per second (m/s).

Title: Effective number of cycles
Description: A relationship between the total number of cycles, amplitude of each half cycle, the amplitude of the largest half cycle, and an application-dependent damage coefficient.

Title: European macroseismic scale
Description: A dimensionless scale of seismic intensity. EMS-98 intensity denotes how strongly an earthquake affects a specific place, with 12 classes I (Not felt) to XII (Completely devastating).

Title: Modified Mercalli Intensity
Description: A dimensionless scale of seismic intensity. MMI intensity denotes how strongly an earthquake affects a specific place, with 10 classes I (Not felt) to X (Extreme).

Title: Cumulative absolute velocity
Description: The relationship between absolute value of acceleration at time t, relative to total duration of the ground motion record. Expressed in meters per second (m/s).

Title: Bracketed duration
Description: The time elapsed between the first and last excursions beyond a specified threshold acceleration (typically 0.05 g or 0.1 g). Expressed in seconds (s).

Title: Inundation depth above ground (m)
Description: Water depth measured relative to ground level. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Inundation depth above ground (cm)
Description: Water depth measured relative to ground level. Expressed in centimeters (cm).

Title: Inundation depth above floor (m)
Description: Water depth measured relative to building floor level. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Inundation depth above floor (cm)
Description: Water depth measured relative to building floor level. Expressed in centimeters (cm).

Title: Flow velocity (m/s)
Description: The rate at which a fluid flows in a flood
column9: debris flow or other. Expressed in meters per second (m/s).

Title: 3-sec at 10m sustained wind speed (kph)
Description: The average speed of the wind over a 3-second time period, measured at a height of 10 meters (about 33 feet) above the ground or sea surface. Expressed in kilometers per hour (kph).

Title: 1-min at 10m sustained wind speed (kph)
Description: The average speed of the wind over a 1-minute time period, measured at a height of 10 meters (about 33 feet) above the ground or sea surface. Expressed in kilometers per hour (kph).

Title: 10-min sustained wind speed (kph)
Description: The average wind speed over a period of 10 minutes. Expressed in kilometers per hour (kph).

Title: 10-min sustained wind speed in m/s
Description: The average wind speed over a period of 10 minutes. Expressed in meters per second (m/s).

Title: Peak gust wind speed
Description: The peak gust wind speed in the open terrain. Expressed in kilometers per hour (kph).

Title: Landslide flow depth
Description: The depth of the landslide flow. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Debris-flow intensity index
Description: A landslide intensity index proposed by Jakob et al. (2012). Expressed in meters cubed per second squared (m3/s2).

Title: Maximum foundation displacement
Description: The maximum (absolute) foundation displacement due to landslide. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: rf_KE
Unit: The kinetic energy of a rockfall
Description: as a function of mass
column6: velocity or energy and fly height of blocks. Expressed in kiloJoules (kJ).

Title: Landslide displacement
Description: The displacement associated with the slow moving landslides. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Tsunami wave runup height (m)
Description: The height reached by water measured relative to a stated datum such as mean sea level, mean low water, sea level at the time of the tsunami. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Tsunami wave height
Description: The vertical distance between the trough (lowest point) and crest (highest point) of a tsunami wave. It is a measure of the amplitude or size of the wave, indicating the magnitude of the water displacement caused by the tsunami. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Tsunami Horizontal Force
Description: The lateral or horizontal force exerted by a tsunami. Expressed in meters (m).

Title: Momentum flux
Description: A vector in the direction of flow, of magnitude equal to the mass-flow per unit area. Expressed in meters cubed per seconds squared (m3/s2).

Title: Modified momentum flux
Description: The product of momentum flux and inundation depth, considered a proxy for the overturning moment induced by the flow. Expressed in meters to the fourth per seconds squared (m4/s2).

Title: Drag force
Description: The force exerted on an object (per unit width perpendicular to the direction of flow) due to the movement of a surrounding fluid. Expressed in kilo Newtons (kN).

Title: Froude number
Description: A measure of flow velocity non-dimensionalized by the gravity-wave velocity.

Title: Quasi-steady force
Description: Steady-state force estimation considering choked and sub-critical flow for a body of width b in a channel of width w. Expressed in kilo Newtons (kN).

Title: Accumulated ashfall thickness (mm)
Description: Accumulated depth or thickness of ash following a volcanic eruption. Expressed in millimeters (mm).

Title: Ash loading
Description: The load of accumulated volcanic ash measured in kilograms per square meter (km/m^2).

Title: Agricultural Stress Index
Description: A quick-look indicator that facilitates the early identification of cropped land with a high likelihood of water stress (drought). Expressed as a percentage (per).

Title: Drought Intensity
Description: Agricultural droughts are classified by their intensity and are categorized into four classes: Extreme, Severe, Moderate or Mild. The intensity of the drought is calculated through the Weighted Mean Vegetation Health Index aggregated per GAUL 2 region. Source: FAO Seasonal Global Indicators.

Title: Weighted Mean Vegetation Health Index
Description: Allows the user to assess the severity of the drought from the start of the growing season, examining the vegetation health and the influence of temperature on plant conditions. Source: FAO Seasonal Global Indicators.

Title: Normalized Difference Vegetation Index
Description: Measures the 'greenness' of ground cover and is used as a proxy to indicate the density and health of vegetation. NDVI values range from +1 to -1, with high positive values corresponding to dense and healthy vegetation, and low and/or negative NDVI values indicating poor vegetation conditions or sparse vegetative cover. The NDVI anomaly indicates the variation of the current dekad to the long-term average. Source: FAO Global Indicators.

Title: Vegetation Condition Index
Description: Evaluates the current vegetation health in comparison to the historical trends. The VCI relates current dekadal Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) to its long-term minimum and maximum, normalized by the historical range of NDVI values for the same dekad. The VCI was designed to separate the weather-related component of the NDVI from the ecological element. Source: FAO Global Indicators.

Title: Vegetation Health Index
Description: Illustrates the severity of drought based on the vegetation health and the influence of temperature on plant conditions. The VHI is a composite index and the elementary indicator used to compute the ASI. It combines both the Vegetation Condition Index (VCI) and the Temperature Condition Index (TCI). Source: FAO Global Indicators.

Title: Crop Moisture Index
Description: The CMI (Eight classes from 'Severely Dry' to 'Excessively Wet') gives the short-term or current status of purely agricultural drought or moisture surplus and can change rapidly from week to week. The CMI indicate general conditions and not local variations caused by isolated rain. Source: https://www.drought.gov/data-maps-tools/crop-moisture-index-cmi.

Title: Palmer Drought Severity Index
Description: An estimate of relative dryness. It is a standardized index that generally spans -10 (dry) to +10 (wet). Source: https://climatedataguide.ucar.edu/climate-data/palmer-drought-severity-index-pdsi.

Title: Standard Precipitation Index
Description: An index to characterize meteorological drought on a range of timescales. On short timescales, the SPI is closely related to soil moisture, while at longer timescales, the SPI can be related to groundwater and reservoir storage. Source: https://climatedataguide.ucar.edu/climate-data/standardized-precipitation-index-spi

Title: Standard Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index
Description: An extension of the Standardized Precipitation Index (SPI). The SPEI is designed to take into account both precipitation and potential evapotranspiration (PET) in determining drought. Source: https://climatedataguide.ucar.edu/climate-data/standardized-precipitation-evapotranspiration-index-spei.

Title: Wet Bulb Globe Temperature in Celsius
Description: A measure of the heat stress in direct sunlight, which takes into account: temperature, humidity, wind speed, sun angle and cloud cover (solar radiation). Expressed in degrees celsius (c).

Title: Fire Weather Index
Description: A meteorologically based dimensionless index used worldwide to estimate fire danger. It consists of different components that account for the effects of fuel moisture and wind on fire behaviour and spread. The higher the FWI is, the more favourable the meteorological conditions to trigger a wildfire.

Title: Multi-Hazard Index
Description: An index describing the prevalence of multiple hazards.
